trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_SEQ_00<tab>The next feat awaits, and Alphinaud would have you on the road as soon as possible.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_TODO_00<tab>Search for villagers of middle age and older.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Hunmu Rruk.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Hunmu Rruk again.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Hunmu Rruk yet again.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_001<tab>I'm relieved that our dish was well received.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ERENVILLE_000_005<tab>One final feat remains. After this one, I hardly know what to expect.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_WUKLAMAT_000_010<tab>Feat of the Brotherhood, here we come!
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ALISAIE_000_015<tab>We need to start considering how to reclaim that keystone from Bakool Ja Ja...
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ALPHINAUD_000_020<tab>Seeing as we now face the penultimate objective of the rite, it would be wise to travel to Mamook and undertake the Feat of the Brotherhood without delay.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ERENVILLE_000_021<tab>Wise, yes, but impossible. The Ty'iinbek Traverse, which connects the upper forest to the Ja Tiika Heartland, is still impassable.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_022<tab>Is there no other route?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ERENVILLE_000_023<tab>I'm afraid not. Work to clear the path is underway, though, so I'm hopeful we can resume our journey soon.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ALPHINAUD_000_024<tab>Then let us each use this time as we see fit.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ALPHINAUD_000_025<tab>I, for one, would like to explore the village's surrounds─if Erenville would oblige me with a tour?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ERENVILLE_000_026<tab>Very well. I have no other engagements.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ALISAIE_000_027<tab>Then I will come with you─if only to prove that I <var 1A 02 /var>am<var 1A 01 /var> capable of keeping my footing.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_028<tab>Though I shouldn't rejoice in our delay, it does afford me an opportunity to look into my grandfather's purported visit to Yak T'el.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_WUKLAMAT_000_029<tab>Oh, that's right! Mablu did say something about a foreign mage coming through here decades back, didn't she? I'll come with you!
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_WUKLAMAT_000_030<tab>Want to join us, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_ALPHINAUD_000_031<tab>Let us reconvene here after our respective diversions.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_032<tab>As I recall, the merchant met my grandfather at a market in Yak T'el some twenty years ago.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_033<tab>Any who might reliably remember him must therefore be at least middle-aged. Let us make inquiries where we can.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_WUKLAMAT_000_040<tab>This fellow looks promising! Definitely older than I am.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_045<tab>I hope someone in Iq Br'aax knows something...
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_XBALAALOLD04901_000_050<tab>A foreign mage, twenty years ago?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_XBALAALOLD04901_000_051<tab>Yes, I remember him. It's not often we get visitors from across the salt, let alone those traveling with infants. A baby girl, as I recall.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_XBALAALOLD04901_000_052<tab>I only saw him in passing, mind─if anyone were to know more, I'd wager it would be Hunmu Rruk. He was already Xbr'aax Rax then.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_053<tab>A baby girl? It couldn't have been...
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_054<tab>Th-Thank you, sir! That information is very helpful.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_XBALAALOLD04901_000_060<tab>If you want to know more about that mage, I'd suggest speaking with Hunmu Rruk. He's sure to remember him.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_WUKLAMAT_000_065<tab>So Hunmu Rruk has been Xbr'aax Rax for over twenty years... That's before I was even born!
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_070<tab>This may be the very lead I was hoping for!
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_075<tab>Hello again. Do you require assistance?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_076<tab>A foreign mage passed through Iq Br'aax roughly twenty years ago, possibly carrying a young child. Do you remember him?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_077<tab>Why do you ask me this? Who is this man to you?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_078<tab>He may have been my grandfather, and I wish to know what brought him here.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_079<tab>Your grandfather?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_080<tab>Not by blood, but he is family nonetheless.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_081<tab>A foreign mage did indeed visit Iq Br'aax. Master Galuf.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_100_081<tab>So far as his identity is concerned, I trust you are satisfied?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_082<tab>More than that, however, I cannot say.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_WUKLAMAT_000_083<tab>Why not?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_084<tab>I simply cannot. I beg your forgiveness and understanding.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_085<tab>Very well, I will not press. Thank you for confirming his presence here─the rest I will discover myself.

TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_086<tab>Out of more <var 1A 02 /var>general<var 1A 01 /var> curiosity, I have another question. They say the Yok Huy once dwelled in these forests. Where was that, exactly?

TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_087<tab><var 1A 02 /var>General<var 1A 01 /var> curiosity, indeed... But yes. Before they withdrew to Urqopacha some five centuries ago, the Yok Huy claimed Yak T'el as their own.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_088<tab>Many of their architectural remains can be found in the lower forests─the Ja Tiika Heartland.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_089<tab>Then that's where they must have had their visions...
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_090<tab>Thank you. That answers much and more.

TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_091<tab>I understand what it means to long for one's family. So believe me when I say that, though my position forbids me from aiding you further, I wish you nothing but success.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_092<tab>By helping the Third Promise find the golden city, you will surely find the answers to your questions.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_093<tab>Speaking of which, I have a query of my own for you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_094<tab>May I request a moment of your company?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_WUKLAMAT_000_095<tab>Go on. We'll wait for you.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_WUKLAMAT_000_100<tab>Go on and see what Hunmu Rruk needs.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_105<tab>So in order to get my answers, I need to find the golden city...
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_KRILE_000_110<tab>Well, that was my intent from the first. I'll do everything in my power to make it happen!
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_115<tab>Thank you for obliging me.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_116<tab>First, let us head to the cenote behind this village.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_120<tab>It was my intention to see you off without saying anything, but Mistress Krile's plea has softened my resolve...
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_121<tab>As the leader of our community, I am gladdened to see that the Third Promise has surrounded herself with such compassionate and trustworthy companions.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_122<tab>Would you tell me of her journey thus far?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_123<tab>Is that so... It seems the rite has been a source of great learning and growth for Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_124<tab>It does me well to hear that.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_125<tab>...My daughter would be about her age.

TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_126<tab>Girls are rarely born amongst the Xbr'aal. So when she arrived, the village was elated. Such joy I felt when first I held her...and pain when I found her at the bottom of a cenote.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_127<tab>Three years old. An accident, it was said. But I knew better.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_128<tab>She had been pushed.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_129<tab>Though we never caught them, a suspicious figure was seen fleeing towards the Ja Tiika Heartland. Towards Mamook.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_130<tab>Once bitter enemies, the Mamool Ja and Xbr'aal had learned to live in peace...

TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_131<tab>But who could doubt the intent of such a reprehensible act? By targeting the child who would one day lead her people, the criminal sought to undermine the future of the Xbr'aal.

TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_132<tab>I was determined not to let them succeed. And so I let the memory of my daughter die in that cenote, and gave her into the care of the one person I knew who could protect her.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_100_132<tab>...Dawnservant Gulool Ja Ja.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_133<tab>Though she was born to lead the Xbr'aal, fate had a greater plan for Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_134<tab>Only the Dawnservant and I know the truth. But I must now take you into my confidence for one reason.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_135<tab>If the villain who attempted to murder my daughter was indeed of Mamook, then rancor towards the Xbr'aal still burns.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_136<tab>I was caught off guard once. I will not suffer the same tragedy again.

TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_137<tab>And so I ask you, not as the Dawnservant's elector but as a father, to watch over the Third Promise. Defend her from her enemies that may be lurking in shadow. Will you do this for me?
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_138<tab>Thank you. From the bottom of my heart.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_GULOOLJAJA_000_139<tab>(-Vow of Resolve Gulool Ja Ja-)Will you hear my question and answer me plainly? Address me not as the ruler of Tuliyollal, but a concerned father.
TEXT_KINGMC105_04901_HUNMURRUK_000_140<tab>Suffice it to say, this conversation must remain between us. Pray breathe not a word of this to anyone.
